result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin L James was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to serve 70 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 70 days time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  
Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
As a convicted felon, defendant may no longer use or possess any firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin L James

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Calvin L James in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Calvin L James in custody. David Behm for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 70 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 70 days time served.  This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/9/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/9/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
No reply from defendant or surety.   vp

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Calvin L James not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Discharge Summary received and filed. sab

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Defense counsel appearing prior to case being called.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

04/17/2015
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Calvin L James in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Calvin L James in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF743 that are attached to the complaint.Sworn for the state:Paul Vento-MPD Officer, Jason Rodriguez-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
